verses.verse: "You shall not see <S%H7200><s%> your countryman <S%H251><s%>'s ox <S%H7794><s%> or <S%H176><s%> his sheep <S%H7716><s%> straying <S%H5080><s%> away, <S%H5080><s%> and pay <S%H5956><s%> no <S%H5956><s%> attention <S%H5956><s%> to them; you shall certainly <S%H7725><s%> bring <S%H7725><s%> them back <S%H7725><s%> to your countryman.

"And if <S%H518><s%> your countryman <S%H251><s%> is not near <S%H7138><s%> you, or if you do not know <S%H3045><s%> him, then you shall bring <S%H622><s%> it home <S%H8432><s%> to your house, <S%H1004><s%> and it shall remain <S%H1961><s%> with you until <S%H5704><s%> your countryman <S%H251><s%> looks <S%H1875><s%> for it; then you shall restore <S%H7725><s%> it to him.

"And thus <S%H3651><s%> you shall do <S%H6213><s%> with his donkey, <S%H2543><s%> and you shall do <S%H6213><s%> the same <S%H3651><s%> with his garment, <S%H8071><s%> and you shall do <S%H6213><s%> likewise <S%H3651><s%> with anything <S%H3605><s%> lost by your countryman, <S%H9><s%> which <S%H251><s%> he has lost and you have found. <S%H834><s%> You are not allowed <S%H6><s%> to neglect <S%H4672><s%> [them.]

"You shall not see <S%H7200><s%> your countryman's donkey <S%H2543><s%> or <S%H176><s%> his ox <S%H7794><s%> fallen <S%H5307><s%> down <S%H5307><s%> on the way, <S%H1870><s%> and pay <S%H5956><s%> no <S%H5956><s%> attention <S%H5956><s%> to them; you shall certainly <S%H6965><s%> help <S%H6965><s%> him to raise <S%H6965><s%> [them] up.

"A woman <S%H802><s%> shall not wear <S%H1961><s%> <S%H5921><s%> man <S%H1397><s%>'s clothing, <S%H3627><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> shall a man put <S%H3847><s%> on a woman's clothing; <S%H8071><s%> for whoever <S%H3605><s%> does <S%H6213><s%> these <S%H428><s%> things <S%H428><s%> is an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God. <S%H430><s%>

"If <S%H3588><s%> you happen <S%H7122><s%> to come <S%H7122><s%> upon a bird's nest <S%H7064><s%> along the way, <S%H1870><s%> in any <S%H3605><s%> tree <S%H6086><s%> or <S%H176><s%> on the ground, <S%H776><s%> with young <S%H667><s%> ones <S%H667><s%> or <S%H176><s%> eggs, <S%H1000><s%> and the mother <S%H517><s%> sitting <S%H7257><s%> on the young <S%H667><s%> or <S%H176><s%> on the eggs, <S%H1000><s%> you shall not take <S%H3947><s%> the mother <S%H517><s%> with the young; <S%H1121><s%>

you shall certainly <S%H7971><s%> let <S%H7971><s%> the mother <S%H517><s%> go, <S%H7971><s%> but the young <S%H1121><s%> you may take <S%H3947><s%> for yourself, in order <S%H4616><s%> that it may be well <S%H3190><s%> with you, and that you may prolong <S%H748><s%> your days. <S%H3117><s%>

"When <S%H3588><s%> you build <S%H1129><s%> a new <S%H2319><s%> house, <S%H1004><s%> you shall make <S%H6213><s%> a parapet <S%H4624><s%> for your roof, <S%H1406><s%> that you may not bring <S%H7760><s%> bloodguilt <S%H1818><s%> on your house <S%H1004><s%> if <S%H3588><s%> anyone <S%H5307><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> from it.

"You shall not sow <S%H2232><s%> your vineyard <S%H3754><s%> with two <S%H3610><s%> kinds <S%H3610><s%> of seed, lest <S%H6435><s%> all <S%H4395><s%> the produce <S%H4395><s%> of the seed <S%H2233><s%> which <S%H834><s%> you have sown, <S%H2232><s%> and the increase <S%H8393><s%> of the vineyard <S%H3754><s%> become <S%H6942><s%> defiled. <S%H6942><s%>
"You shall not plow <S%H9177><s%> with an ox <S%H7794><s%> and a donkey <S%H2543><s%> together. <S%H9191><s%>
"You shall not wear <S%H3847><s%> a material <S%H8162><s%> mixed <S%H8162><s%> of wool <S%H6785><s%> and linen <S%H6593><s%> together. <S%H9191><s%>
"You shall make <S%H6213><s%> yourself tassels <S%H1434><s%> on the four <S%H702><s%> corners <S%H3671><s%> of your garment <S%H3682><s%> with which <S%H834><s%> you cover <S%H3680><s%> yourself.
"If <S%H3588><s%> any <S%H376><s%> man <S%H376><s%> takes <S%H3947><s%> a wife <S%H802><s%> and goes <S%H935><s%> in to her and [then] turns <S%H8130><s%> against <S%H8130><s%> her,

and charges <S%H7760><s%> her with shameful <S%H5949><s%> deeds <S%H1697><s%> and publicly <S%H3318><s%> defames <S%H8034><s%> <S%H7451><s%> <S%H3318><s%> her, and says, <S%H559><s%> 'I took <S%H3947><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> woman, <S%H802><s%> [but] when I came <S%H7126><s%> near <S%H7126><s%> her, I did not find <S%H4672><s%> her a virgin, <S%H1331><s%>'

then the girl's father and her mother <S%H1><s%> shall take <S%H517><s%> and bring <S%H3947><s%> out the [evidence] of the girl's virginity <S%H3318><s%> to the elders <S%H1331><s%> of the city <S%H2205><s%> at the gate. <S%H5892><s%>

"And the girl's father shall say <S%H1><s%> to the elders, <S%H559><s%> 'I gave <S%H2205><s%> my daughter <S%H5414><s%> to this <S%H1323><s%> man <S%H2088><s%> for a wife, <S%H376><s%> but he turned <S%H802><s%> against <S%H8130><s%> her;

and behold, <S%H2009><s%> he has charged <S%H7760><s%> her with shameful <S%H5949><s%> deeds, <S%H1697><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "I did not find <S%H4672><s%> your daughter <S%H1323><s%> a virgin. <S%H1331><s%>" But this <S%H428><s%> is the [evidence] of my daughter's virginity. <S%H1331><s%>' And they shall spread <S%H6566><s%> the garment <S%H8071><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the city. <S%H5892><s%>
"So the elders <S%H2205><s%> of that city <S%H5892><s%> shall take <S%H3947><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> and chastise <S%H3256><s%> him,

and they shall fine <S%H6064><s%> him a hundred <S%H3967><s%> [shekels] of silver <S%H3701><s%> and give <S%H5414><s%> it to the girl's father, because <S%H1><s%> he publicly <S%H3588><s%> defamed <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8034><s%> <S%H7451><s%> a virgin <S%H3318><s%> of Israel. <S%H1330><s%> And she shall remain <S%H3478><s%> his wife; <S%H1961><s%> he cannot <S%H802><s%> <S%H3201><s%> divorce <S%H3808><s%> her all <S%H7971><s%> his days. <S%H3605><s%>
"But if <S%H518><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> charge <S%H1697><s%> is true, <S%H571><s%> that the girl <S%H5291><s%> was not found <S%H4672><s%> a virgin, <S%H1331><s%>

then they shall bring <S%H3318><s%> out the girl <S%H5291><s%> to the doorway <S%H6607><s%> of her father's house, <S%H1004><s%> and the men <S%H376><s%> of her city <S%H5892><s%> shall stone <S%H5619><s%> her to death <S%H4191><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> she has committed <S%H6213><s%> an act <S%H5039><s%> of folly <S%H5039><s%> in Israel, <S%H3478><s%> by playing <S%H2181><s%> the harlot <S%H2181><s%> in her father's house; <S%H1004><s%> thus you shall purge <S%H1197><s%> the evil <S%H9563><s%> from among <S%H7130><s%> you.

"If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> is found <S%H4672><s%> lying <S%H7901><s%> with a married <S%H1166><s%> <S%H1167><s%> woman, <S%H802><s%> then both <S%H1571><s%> <S%H8147><s%> of them shall die, <S%H4191><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> who lay <S%H7901><s%> with the woman, <S%H802><s%> and the woman; <S%H802><s%> thus you shall purge <S%H1197><s%> the evil <S%H9563><s%> from Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

"If <S%H3588><s%> there is a girl <S%H5291><s%> who is a virgin <S%H1330><s%> engaged <S%H781><s%> to a man, <S%H376><s%> and [another] man <S%H376><s%> finds <S%H4672><s%> her in the city <S%H5892><s%> and lies <S%H7901><s%> with her,

then you shall bring <S%H3318><s%> them both <S%H8147><s%> out to the gate <S%H8179><s%> of that city <S%H5892><s%> and you shall stone <S%H5619><s%> them to death; <S%H4191><s%> the girl, <S%H5291><s%> because <S%H5921><s%> <S%H1697><s%> <S%H834><s%> she did not cry <S%H6817><s%> out in the city, <S%H5892><s%> and the man, <S%H376><s%> because <S%H5921><s%> <S%H1697><s%> <S%H834><s%> he has violated <S%H6031><s%> his neighbor's wife. <S%H802><s%> Thus you shall purge <S%H1197><s%> the evil <S%H9563><s%> from among <S%H7130><s%> you.

"But if <S%H518><s%> in the field <S%H7704><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> finds <S%H4672><s%> the girl <S%H5291><s%> who is engaged, <S%H781><s%> and the man <S%H376><s%> forces <S%H2388><s%> her and lies <S%H7901><s%> with her, then only <S%H905><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> who <S%H834><s%> lies <S%H7901><s%> with her shall die. <S%H4191><s%>

"But you shall do <S%H6213><s%> nothing <S%H3808><s%> <S%H1697><s%> to the girl; <S%H5291><s%> there <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> sin <S%H2399><s%> in the girl <S%H5291><s%> worthy of death, <S%H4194><s%> for just <S%H3152><s%> as a man <S%H376><s%> rises <S%H6965><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> and murders <S%H7523><s%> him, so <S%H3651><s%> is this <S%H2088><s%> case. <S%H1697><s%>

"When <S%H3588><s%> he found <S%H4672><s%> her in the field, <S%H7704><s%> the engaged <S%H781><s%> girl <S%H5291><s%> cried <S%H6817><s%> out, but there <S%H369><s%> was no <S%H369><s%> one to save <S%H3467><s%> her.

"If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> finds <S%H4672><s%> a girl <S%H5291><s%> who is a virgin, <S%H1330><s%> who <S%H834><s%> is not engaged, <S%H781><s%> and seizes <S%H8610><s%> her and lies <S%H7901><s%> with her and they are discovered, <S%H4672><s%>

then the man <S%H376><s%> who lay <S%H7901><s%> with her shall give <S%H5414><s%> to the girl's father fifty <S%H1><s%> [shekels] of silver, <S%H2572><s%> and she shall become <S%H3701><s%> his wife <S%H1961><s%> because <S%H802><s%> <S%H8478><s%> he has violated <S%H834><s%> her; he cannot <S%H6031><s%> <S%H3201><s%> divorce <S%H3808><s%> her all <S%H7971><s%> his days. <S%H3605><s%>
"A man <S%H376><s%> shall not take <S%H3947><s%> his father's wife <S%H802><s%> so that he shall not uncover <S%H1540><s%> his father's skirt. <S%H3671><s%>
